overview: This subject introduces students to the general principles of veterinary microbiology and to the study of viral infectious agents as causes of disease in animals. It includes taxonomic and biological considerations of common and important viral pathogens, the host-pathogen interaction and the pathogenesis of disease. Key aspects of disease transmission and epidemiology are addressed, as well as methods of diagnosis of viral disease and their prevention, control and treatment.

additional pre-requisite: Satisfactory completion of all subjects at DVM 1 level

assessments.description: 5 small assignments based on the practical classes, their content and application to case based scenarios.. 5 words (each)
Written examination. 2 hours. Hurdle requirement:. Students must achieve a minimum mark of 40% in the written examination to be eligible to pass the subject
Aggregate Mark. Hurdle requirement:. Students must pass the subject on aggregate mark.

Semester 1.Contact hours: 43 hours of lectures, practical classes and workshops

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
